description:
Hecatera dysodea, commonly known as the Ranunculus Moth, is a species of noctuid moth found in Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Noctuidae, which includes a large number of moth species.

The Ranunculus Moth is a small to medium-sized moth, with a wingspan ranging from 30 to 35 millimeters. The forewings are typically grayish-brown in color, with dark brown or black markings and a distinctive pattern of lines and spots. The hindwings are pale gray or whitish in color.

The larvae of the Ranunculus Moth feed on various species of buttercup (Ranunculus) plants, which are their primary host plants. The moths are typically active at night and can be attracted to artificial light sources.

Hecatera dysodea is not considered a pest species and is generally not of significant economic importance. However, it is an integral part of the natural ecosystem, contributing to the biodiversity and functioning of the habitats it inhabits.
